sectiondef.header: Fatal error routines for certain types of errors

description.para: These wrap gmx_error() and provide the key parameter as one of the recognized strings.

briefdescription.para: Prints filename and line to stdlog.
Helper macro to pass first three parameters to gmx_fatal().
Alternative fatal error routine with canned messages.

detaileddescription.para: This works as gmx_fatal(), except that a generic error message is added based on a string key, and printf-style formatting is not supported. Should not typically be called directly, but through gmx_call() etc.

briefdescription.para: Checks that a variable is within a range.

detaileddescription.para: If n is not in range [n_min, n_max), a fatal error is raised. n_min is inclusive, but n_max is not.

briefdescription.para: Checks that a variable is within a range.

detaileddescription.para: This works as range_check_mesg(), but with a default error message.

briefdescription.para: Clean exit is possible.

detaileddescription.para: There should be no concurrently executing code that might be accessing global objects, and all MPI ranks should reach the same fatal error.

briefdescription.para: Program needs to be aborted.

detaileddescription.para: There are no preconditions for this state.

briefdescription.para: Program needs to be aborted, but some other rank is responsible of it.

detaileddescription.para: There should be some other MPI rank that reaches the same fatal error, but uses ExitType_Abort. The other ranks can then use ExitType_NonMasterAbort to wait for that one rank to issue the abort.

briefdescription.para: Identifies the state of the program on a fatal error.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* gmx_error_handler_t)(const char *title, const char *msg, const char *file, int line)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const char *title, const char *msg, const char *file, int line)
memberdef.name: gmx_error_handler_t

briefdescription.para: Function pointer type for fatal error handler callback.
Debug log file.
Whether extra debugging is enabled.
Initializes debugging variables.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not threadsafe. It should be called as part of initializing GROMACS, before any other thread accesses the library. For command line programs, gmx::CommandLineModuleManager takes care of this if the user requests debugging.

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE when the program was started in debug mode.
Implementation for where().
Sets the log file for printing error messages.
Sets an error handler for gmx_fatal() and other fatal error routines.

detaileddescription.para: The default handler prints the message. GROMACS will terminate the program after the error handler returns. To make gmx_fatal_collective() work, the error handler should not terminate the program, as it cannot know what is the desired way of termination. The message passed to the handler may be a multi-line string.

briefdescription.para: Helper function to terminate the program on a fatal error.

parameterdescription.para: Identifies the state of the program at the time of the call, determining how the program can be terminated.
Exit code for the program, for cases where it can be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int fatal_errno, const char *file, int line, gmx_bool bMaster, gmx_bool bFinalize, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
memberdef.name: gmx_fatal_mpi_va

briefdescription.para: Low-level fatal error reporting routine for collective MPI errors.

detaileddescription.para: This function works as gmx_fatal(), but provides additional control for cases where it is known that the same error occurs on multiple MPI ranks. The error handler is called only if bMaster is TRUE, and MPI_Finalize() is called instead of MPI_Abort() in MPI-enabled GROMACS if bFinalize is TRUE.
This is used to implement gmx_fatal_collective() (which cannot be declared here, since it would bring with it mdrun-specific dependencies).

memberdef.argsstring: (int fatal_errno, const char *file, int line, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: gmx_fatal

briefdescription.para: Fatal error reporting routine for GROMACS.

detaileddescription.para: This function prints a fatal error message with a header that contains the source file and line number of the call, followed by the string specified by fmt and supplied parameters. If fatal_errno is 0, only the message and arguments are printed. If fatal_errno is a legal system errno or -1, a perror()-like message is printed after the first message; if fatal_errno is -1, the last system errno will be used. The format of fmt uses printf()-like formatting.
In case all MPI processes want to stop with the same fatal error, use gmx_fatal_collective(), declared in network.h, to avoid having as many error messages as processes.
The first three parameters can be provided through FARGS: gmx_fatal(FARGS,fmt,...);

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *key, const char *msg, const char *file, int line)
memberdef.name: _gmx_error

briefdescription.para: Implementation for gmx_error().

memberdef.argsstring: (int n, int n_min, int n_max, const char *warn_str, const char *var, const char *file, int line)
memberdef.name: _range_check

briefdescription.para: Implementation for range_check() and range_check_mesg().
Prints a warning message to stderr.

detaileddescription.para: The format of fmt uses printf()-like formatting. The message string should NOT start with "WARNING" and should NOT end with a newline.

briefdescription.para: Declares fatal error handling and debugging routines for C code.
